title: Guards at burned Mexican detention center didn't have keys
description: Two guards who fled a fire that killed 40 migrants in a locked cell at a Mexican detention center did not have keys to the cell door

title: State media says Iran president replacing 2 Cabinet members
description: State media says Iran President Ebrahaim Raisi has announced a Cabinet reshuffle, replacing the minister of agriculture and the head of the planning and budget office

title: Puerto Rico declares state of emergency on coastal erosion
description: Puerto Rico’s governor has declared a state of emergency to fight worsening coastal erosion across the U.S. territory that officials blame on climate change

title: Mexican tourist killed in Mexican resort of Tulum
description: A Mexican tourist has been shot to death in the Caribbean coast resort of Tulum in a dramatic robbery inside a coffee shop

title: Netanyahu appeals for unity amid violence, but risks losing control
description: With Israel’s crises stacking up, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu addressed a country in need of reassurance.

title: Chile lawmakers vote to reduce work week from 45 to 40 hours
description: Chile’s Congress has approved a law gradually reducing the work week from 45 to 40 hours, a decision hailed by the government as a breakthrough for workers’ rights

title: Trudeau provides more Ukraine aid, dismisses site being down
description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau have announced more military aid to support Ukraine in its war with Russia while hosting Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal in Toronto

title: 14 dead in 3 days of tribal violence in Sudan's West Darfur
description: Activists say bloodshed in Sudan’s long-troubled Darfur region has left at least 14 people dead over the last three days

title: Ukraine resumes electricity exports despite Russian attacks
description: Ukraine’s energy ministger says the country has begun resuming electricity exports to European countries, in a dramatic turnaround from just six months ago

title: Gunmen kill 5 soldiers in Niger convoy ambush
description: Niger’s army says gunmen killed five soldiers and wounded others during a weekend ambush of a military convoy performing escort duties

title: Israeli army kills 2 alleged Palestinian gunmen in West Bank
description: The Israeli military shot and killed two Palestinians who allegedly opened fire at troops from their car in the northern West Bank, the latest incident in a wave of deadly violence gripping the occupied territory

title: Russia moves to tighten conscription law, pressing more men to fight
description: The new rules would allow electronic conscription instead of paper summonses and would impose stiff restrictions on men who do not report for required military duty.

title: Germany expels Chad's ambassador after own envoy kicked out
description: Germany has ordered Chad’s ambassador to leave the country, responding to the central African nation’s expulsion last week of the German ambassador

title: U.S. deems WSJ reporter ‘wrongfully detained.’ What does that mean?
description: The U.S. determination that Evan Gershkovich is “wrongfully detained” unlocks additional State Department resources for the effort to secure his release.

title: Taliban: Raid kills 8 rebel fighters in Afghanistan's north
description: The Taliban say a raid on a rebel hideout in northern Afghanistan has killed eight people from the National Resistance Front, including a commander

title: Macron’s Taiwan comments anger allies, delight Beijing
description: The interview in question took place during a three-day visit to China that raised eyebrows for its surprisingly upbeat tone considering that Beijing has yet to condemn Russia’s war in Ukraine.

title: Israeli Holocaust memorial criticizes deal with Poland
description: Israel’s national Holocaust memorial has criticized a new agreement renewing Israeli school trips to Poland, saying it recommends a number of “problematic sites” that distort history

title: Russian forces in Crimea brace for possible Ukraine assault
description: The Moscow-appointed leader of Crimea says the region is on guard for what may be an impending Ukrainian counteroffensive

title: Myanmar military airstrike kills dozens in Sagaing region, opposition leaders say
description: The attack, carried out by a fighter jet and military helicopter on Kanbalu Township, may be one of the deadliest since Myanmar's military coup.

title: Germany launches plan to relax rigid family name system
description: Germany’s justice minister has launched plans to relax the country’s strict restrictions on family names — for example, allowing couples to take double-barreled surnames and pass them on to their children

title: Court in Pakistan-held Kashmir removes Imran Khan's protégé
description: A top court in the Pakistani-administered section of Kashmir has removed the protégé of former Prime Minister Imran Khan and head of the local government from office

title: Dana Nemcova, leading Czech anti-communist, dies at 89
description: One of the leading Czech dissidents and human rights activists from the communist era has died at the age of 89

title: China practices attacking Taiwan from the east, a worrying development
description: China used military drills to practice attacking Taiwan from the Pacific Ocean — an area traditionally dominated by the U.S. and its Asian allies.

title: Volcano eruption on Russia's Kamchatka spews vast ash clouds
description: A volcano has erupted on far eastern Russia’s far eastern Kamchatka Peninsula

title: UN to review presence in Afghanistan following Taliban ban
description: The United Nations says it’s reviewing its presence in Afghanistan after the Taliban barred Afghan women from working for the world organization — a veiled suggestion that the U.N. could move to suspend its mission and operations in the embattled country

title: U.N calls for massive international support to Somalia
description: U

title: ‘It’s disgusting’: Bali locals are fed up with bad tourists
description: Since Bali reopened for travel, an uptick in unruly behavior from tourists has pushed Indonesian officials to think up new ways to address offenders.

title: S Korea to conduct 1st launch of commercial-grade satellite
description: South Korea plans to conduct its first launch of a commercial-grade satellite aboard a domestically built rocket next month as part of its space development program

title: This badge of a bear punching Winnie the Pooh is a bit hit in Taiwan
description: Taiwanese air force pilots are wearing the badges showing a native bear punching Winnie the Pooh, a meme stand-in for China's Xi Jinping. Taiwan is loving it.

title: French building collapse kills 6, gas explosion suspected
description: A French prosecutor says investigators are treating the deaths of at least six people who were killed when a building collapsed in the city of Marseille as a possible “involuntary homicide” case

title: South Korea says leaked U.S. documents were ‘altered’ and are ‘untrue’
description: Confidential U.S. documents purport to show American officials putting pressure on their South Korean counterparts to help supply weapons to Ukraine.

title: UK junior doctors begin 4-day strike, seeking hefty pay hike
description: Tens of thousands of doctors have walked off the job across England in a four-day strike billed as the most disruptive in the history of the U.K.’s public health service

title: 25 years after Good Friday Agreement, cold peace prevails in Northern Ireland
description: Communities here are skeptical of the celebratory mood as President Biden and other luminaries descend on Belfast this week.

title: Macron visits Netherlands after Taiwan comments make waves
description: French President Emmanuel Macron is set to begin a two-day state visit to the Netherlands and is outlining his vision for the future of Europe at a speech in The Hague, after making waves with comments about the continent’s relationship with Taiwan

title: UN agency investigating humanitarian food theft in Ethiopia
description: The United Nations food relief agency is investigating the theft of food aid from lifesaving humanitarian operations in Ethiopia, according to a letter obtained by The Associated Press

title: Germany: 'Uncooperative' squirrel freed from manhole cover
description: Firefighters say they have freed an “uncooperative” squirrel that was stuck in a manhole cover in western Germany

title: Ukraine live briefing: Leak reveals challenges of likely counteroffensive; Russia bolsters defenses near Finland
description: A top Russian general said the Kremlin will ramp up its air defenses near Finland, which recently became the newest member of NATO.

title: Shootout in southwest Pakistan kills 4 policemen, militant
description: Pakistani police say security forces raided a suspected hideout of the Pakistani Taliban in the southwestern city of Quetta, triggering a shootout that killed four police officers and a militant commander

title: Hundreds flee from wildfire in South Korean seaside city
description: Hundreds of people have been forced to flee as a wildfire destroyed dozens of homes in a South Korean coastal city

title: Good Friday Agreement is a rare success story of 1990s U.S. diplomacy
description: The 25th anniversary of the pact is a reminder of the relative failure of two other Clinton-era diplomatic agreements in the Middle East and the Balkans.
